ctu_text: ", "answer": "The Nationwide Artificial Insemination Programme is open to all dairy farmers in India, including those in Madhya Pradesh. Farmers must have a minimum of five cows in their herd and must have a valid milk producers federation card. They must also have access to quality semen and a trained technician to perform the insemination. The programme is open to farmers from all socio-economic backgrounds.
